questions.question: Symbolize the statement 'John is healthy and wealthy but not wise' using h for 'healthy,' w for 'wealthy,' and s for 'wise.'
Write the truth table for the logical expression ∼ (p ∧ q) ∨ (p ∨ q).
questions.answer: This table shows that it is a tautology, as it evaluates to True in all cases.

questions.question: Is the statement form p ∨ (p ∧ q) logically equivalent to q?
questions.answer: Not logically equivalent as their truth values do not match in all cases.
